dct_description_sm: R.B. Marshall, chief geographer , W.H. Herron, geographer in charge , topography by L.L. Lee and H.E. Burney , control by U.S. Lake Survey, J.R. Ellis, J.H. Wilson, R.G. Clinte, and E.C. Bibbee. Filing title: Mich.-Ind. Three Rivers. Edition of 1916. Polyconic projection. Relief shown by contours and spot heights, depths shown by soundings and isolines. Contour interval 20 feet. Includes map showing areas surveyed by Lee and Burney. Shows portion of St. Joseph County, Michigan, and small portions of Elkhart and LaGrange counties in Indiana. Surveyed in 1914. Reprinted 1932. At head of map: "State of Michigan represented by the Department of Conservation Geological Survey."
Imprint: Washington, D.C. : Dept. of the Interior, U.S. Geological Survey, 1932
dct_creator_sm: Lee, L. L. (Luria Lyons), 1882-1962; Burney, H. E.; U.S. Lake Survey; Herron, W. H. (William Harrison), 1865-; Geological Survey (U.S.); Marshall, R. B. (Robert Bradford), 1867-1949; Michigan. Geological Survey
